description.en:
The Beginner Kazakh Language course introduces students to essential elements of the Kazakh language, focusing on practical communication skills. Students start by learning the Kazakh Cyrillic alphabet, with special emphasis on accurate pronunciation and phonetics. Vocabulary lessons cover common words and phrases useful for everyday interactions, such as greetings, introductions, and basic questions. Grammar instruction includes simple sentence structures, basic verb conjugations, and the use of pronouns. Through guided activities, students practice forming sentences and using them in short dialogues.
Reading and writing exercises help students gain confidence in recognizing and producing written Kazakh. Listening exercises expose students to native Kazakh speakers, enhancing their ability to understand common conversational patterns. Cultural lessons introduce Kazakh traditions, etiquette, and social norms, preparing students for culturally appropriate communication. By participating in role-play and other interactive activities, students develop practical speaking skills. By the end of the course, students will be equipped to handle basic conversations and navigate everyday situations in Kazakh confidently.

objectives.en: This beginner Kazakh course aims to build foundational language skills for everyday communication. Students will learn basic vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation to engage in simple conversations and understand common phrases. The course includes reading and writing practice in the Kazakh Cyrillic alphabet, with exercises designed to develop confidence in real-life situations like introductions, shopping, and asking for directions. Additionally, students will gain insights into Kazakh culture, customs, and etiquette, enhancing both language proficiency and cultural understanding.
